ratings.comment: Dr. Combs is a wonderful person who is very passionate about what he teaches. I wish he was lecturing more and took at least a little more control over labs. The TAs seemed very unprepared and so the labs were chaotic and hard to do. This class is extremely hard if you don't study a lot, care about the subject, and have previous experience

An absolutely wonderful professor that I will miss having. Dr. Combs is good at what he does. He knows that it is better to have an expert speak on subjects he is unfamiliar with and organized the Fall 2018 class very well. The only downside was the harsh grading by TAs of lab reports as well as their specific, unrelated questions.

Dr. Combs is by far my favorite professor in the animal science/dairy science department. He is SUPER caring about ALL of students. He is super flexible and easy going. He is very knowledgeable and a good lecturer.

Really good professor knows his stuff, usually had other lecturers come in. Definitely willing to help you out. The TAs were god awful. If you have an agriculture background at all you should get an A/AB.

David Combs is a great instructor, the problem is that he doesn't instruct very much. Lectures are usually taught by other professors that don't really want to be there. The best part of this class is the labs, they are a lot of fun but make sure to be very detailed on the lab worksheets. Quizzes are from lab material and tests from lecture.

Dr. Combs is a good guy, but 101 is rough. I struggled to bring myself to that class most days. Dr. Combs usually doesn't lecture, he brings in other professors to lecture on different topics. The other professors don't appear to want to be there teaching and tests can be difficult because you are expected to know specific details on broad topics.

Dr. Combs is super caring, funny, and a good lecturer. Don't take this class unless you need it for your major though. In order to do well, you basically have to memorize all of the PowerPoint slides and every word the lecturers say. I thought it was graded too harshly, and the teaching team was disorganized. So stressful.

Dr. Combs is a nice guy who is very approachable and knowledgable. The class is basic and if you have a moderate background with agriculture you will do well. The labs are by far the best part of the class, every week the class learns about and interacts with different species of livestock!
He's a very jolly guy, tends to ramble, and is a bit unorganized. Overall hes a sweet professor.

A humble & laid back professor! Lectures tend to be incredibly interesting, and definitely learned something new each lecture. The labs are interesting as well, unlike any science labs I've ever taken before, given the fact that you're working with animals for all of them.  If you have any questions, he's willing to share any info. he can to help!

Great guy, very approachable. Everything is online but you have to show up to lectures just in case he covers something not on the notes. Class wasn't too hard but sometimes they put questions on the tests on material that wasn't covered (only one or two). If your like me and have a strong Ag background you can pass with minimal effort.
Dr. Combs is an extremely good professor who tries to keep lecture interesting.  He does an extremely good job at relating the material to students.

He's a great professor and works well with Prof. Cook. Everything's available on-line (powerpoints), however, they aren't always up-to-date and some may take a few days before he puts them up. But usually they're up before class begins.

Awesome prof.  Keeps things simplistic and doesn't expect TOO much.  His tests are thorough, but not really difficult.  This man has extensive experience in the field of animal and dairy science and it shows.  He conveys the messages of each lecture thoroughly, but seems to have fun doing it.  Lab is also a blast
He is very funny and keeps the material interesting. His stories add a personal touch and you'll never forget them!! I strongly reccomend that you take classes taught by him.
